alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 04 at 3:29AM MST until January 06 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and west central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Chouteau; Eastern Pondera; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
